page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY The literal meaning of Stanton derives from the latin word which means stoney estate. The village is very old and boasts the remains of a Roman fort, although there is some disagreement as to where it is exactly situated. It was thought to have been used as a staging post for provisioning the soldiers and watering the horses of the Roman Legion. The well known Shropshire authoress Mary Webb once lived in the local manor house at Harcourt which was then known as The Woodlands. It is thought that parts of the locality were used in one of her books although the setting of the book is America. There is a fairly ancient building very small, which used to be used as a prison. A small stone bridge across the River Roden bears the date 1791.
